topic.title: SERDES Configuration API Details

body.p: This section outlines the SERDES API of the SDK. For SERDES PRBS configuration please see sections P56 SERDES Pattern Generation API and M10 SERDES Loopback API.
The control points for the SERDES block is shown in Figure 1 below and the API list is in Table 1 below.

note.p: The source file for the block diagram can be found at http://bby1dms01.pmc-sierra.internal/DocMgmt/getfile.cfm?file_id=445860

entry.p: Used to configure one or more SERDES pins on a SERDes port's transmit data source between the default upstream subsystem and data sources internal to the SHW and P56 internal blocks or a receive data loopback.
Used to configure the data sources down stream of one or more receive SERDES pins for a SERDES Port.
Sets the SERDES transmit (output) to be disabled or enabled for all pins assigned to the specified OTN/Ethernet port or Interlaken interface referenced by the channel ID.
Configures the transmit swing for the specified SERDES port.
Configures the LOS defect source of a single SERDES port on the device. The SERDES port id identifies the Bank/SHI block/Lane configuration and applies the specified LOS configuration.
Retrieves the summary SERDES status for the specified OTN/Ethernet port or Interlaken interface referenced by the channel ID.
Retrieves the SERDES configuration for the specified OTN/Ethernet port or Interlaken interface referenced by the channel ID.
Retrieves the status for the specified SERDES pin.
Retrieves the configuration for the specified SERDES pin.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_tx_source_set()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_tx_source_set() API is used to configure one or more SERDES port's pin transmit data source between the default upstream subsystem and data sources internal to the SHW and P56 internal blocks or a receive data loopback. Transmit to receive loopback is not simultaneously supported with receive to transmit loopback on a per port basis and are configured with the g5_api_serdes_rx_source_set() API with the source set to G5_SERDES_TX_SRC_RX_P_N. If either of these loopbacks are activated which the other loopback is already active, then the original loopback will be turned off. The value of squelch_data is applied to all pins in port. If per pin 64 byte patterns are required use source G5_SERDES_TX_SRC_SHW_PRBS and g5_api_serdes_prbs_set() to specify a 64 byte pattern per pin. The g5_api_serdes_tx_source_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The chnl_id represents a physical SERDES port connection. The valid range for serdes_port_id is 0-71 and G5_LKN_INTF0/1/2. The source parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_serdes_tx_src_t that choses the SERDES transmit P/N output data source. See Table 2 below for the source options for g5_serdes_tx_src_t.

entry.p: Default DSIS -> SHW -> Transmit P/N path selection.
SHW PRBS/Pattern Gen -> Transmit P/N path selection.
P56 PRBS/Pattern Gen -> Transmit P/N path selection.
Receive to Transmit Facility Loopback - Not supported simultaneously with Transmit to Receive Loopback.
64 bit Data Squelch -> Transmit P/N path selection

section.p: The squelch_data_msw and squelch_data_lsw parameters are the most and least significant words of the 64 bit squelch pattern when source = G5_SERDES_TX_SRC_SQUELCH.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_rx_source_set()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_rx_source_set() API is used to configure the data sources down stream of one or more receive SERDES pins for a SERDES Port. The data source for the Receive DSIS path may be the actual receive SERDES data, the data from the Transmit DSIS path (diagnostic loopback), or a forced 64 bit pattern. Transmit to receive loopback is not simultaneously supported with receive to transmit loopback on a per port basis and are configured with the g5_api_serdes_rx_source_set() API with the source set to G5_SERDES_TX_SRC_RX_P_N. If either of these loopbacks are activated which the other loopback is already active, then the original loopback will be turned off. The g5_api_serdes_rx_source_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The chnl_id represents a physical SERDES port connection. The valid range for serdes_port_id is 0-71 and G5_ILKN_INTF0/ 1/2. The source parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_serdes_rx_src_t that choses the SERDES receive P/N output data source. See Table 3 below for the source options for g5_serdes_rx_src_t.

entry.p: Default RX P/N -> SHW -> DSIS path selection.
Transmit to receive Diagnostic Loopback - Not supported simultaneously with receive to transmit loopback.
64 bit Data Squelch -> Receive P/N path selection

section.p: The squelch_data_msw and squelch_data_lsw parameters are the most and least significant words of the 64 bit squelch pattern when source = G5_SERDES_TX_SRC_SQUELCH.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_tx_ctrl_set()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_tx_ctrl_set() API sets the SERDES transmit (output) to be disabled or enabled for all pins assigned to the specified OTN/ENET port or ILKN interface referenced by the channel ID. This may be used to squelch the output when G5_SERDES_LOOPBACK_TX is used with the g5_api_serdes_loopback_set() API. The g5_api_serdes_tx_ctrl_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The chnl_id parameter is the user channel ID or the reserved channel ID for the Interlaken interface. The port_pin_b parameter selects if the settings are applied to all the pins or just the serdes_port_id pin for provisioned ports. For non provisioned ports the settings are only applied to the serdes_port_id pin. The action parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_serdes_cfg_act_t which has two options as shown in Table 4 below.

entry.p: When applied to a provisioned port, the configuration will be applied immediately. Note that the default setting will not be changed. When applied to a non-provisioned port, this will set the default state that will be used when the port is provisioned in the future.
Configuration will be stored for default setting on next provisioning.

section.p: The tx_disable parameter of the g5_api_serdes_tx_ctrl_set() API controls the disabling of the transmitter. When set to TRUE, the transmitter is disabled. When set to FALSE, the transmitter is enabled.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_port_tx_swing_set()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_port_tx_swing_set() API configures the TX swing for the specified SERDES port. The g5_api_serdes_port_tx_swing_set() API has the following input parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The serdes_port_id parameter is the SERDES port number(0-71). The action parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_serdes_cfg_act_t which has two options as shown in Table 4 above. The tx_swing parameter is the requested transmit swing with a valid range of 0-7, corresponding to a range of 0.6Vppd(0) and 1.2Vppd(7).

section.title: g5_api_serdes_polarity_set()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_polarity_set() API configures the SERDES pin polarity. The g5_api_serdes_polarity_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The serdes_port_id parameter is the SERDES port number(0-71). The port_pin_b parameter selects if the settings are applied to all the pins or just the serdes_port_id pin for provisioned ports. For non provisioned ports the settings are only applied to the serdes_port_id pin. The dir_tx_rx_b parameter selects the transmit or receive direction. The action parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_serdes_cfg_act_t which has two options as shown in Table 4 above. The invert parameter selects inverted when set to TRUE and non-inverted when set to FALSE.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_port_los_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_port_los_cfg() API configures the LOS defect source of a single SERDES port on the device. The SERDES port ID identifies the Bank/SHI block/Lane configuration and applies the specified LOS configuration. The SERDES port identifier is generated manually and must be based on the rules for configuring a SERDES port identifier. This function applies the LOS settings initially or dynamically after the SERDES port has been configured and is used. All LOS settings are applied immediately. The g5_api_serdes_port_los_cfg() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The serdes_port_id represents a physical SERDES port connection. The valid range for serdes_port_id is 0-71. The dlos_enable parameter choses whether to enable DLOS handling for this port. The los_inv parameter is the LOS pin polarity inverted flag. When los_inv is set to TRUE, the LOS polarity is inverted, when set to FALSE the polarity is not inverted. The los_pin parameter is the LOS pin index for this connection and has a valid range of 0-29. The los_enable parameter chooses whether to enable LOS handling for this port. When los_enable is set to TRUE, the LOS defect is enabled, when set to FALSE, the LOS defect is disabled.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_status_get()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_status_get() API retrieves the summary SERDES status for the specified OTN/Ethernet port or Interlaken interface referenced by the channel ID. The g5_api_serdes_status_get() API has the following input parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The chnl_id parameter is the user channel ID or the reserved channel ID for the Interlaken interface.
The g5_api_serdes_status_get() API returns the status_ptr pointer with the g5_serdes_status_t structure that has the following members:

When the tx_ready status is TRUE, all lanes within the port are active and transmitting at correct rate. When the tx_ready status is set to FALSE, one or more lanes within the port are not active. When the rx_ready status is set to TRUE, all lanes within the port have adapted to received signal. When the rx_ready status is set to FALSE, one or more lanes within the port have not adapted, and receive data is invalid.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_cfg_get()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_cfg_get() API retrieves the SERDES configuration for the specified OTN/Ethernet port or Interlaken interface referenced by the channel ID. The g5_api_serdes_cfg_get() API has the following input parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The chnl_id parameter is the user channel ID or the reserved channel ID for the Interlaken interface.
The g5_api_serdes_cfg_get() API returns the cfg_ptr pointer with the g5_serdes_cfg_t structure that has the following members:
The port_rate member of the g5_serdes_cfg_t structure is defined by the enumerated type for the SERDES pin rates shown in Table 5 below.

The rx_source member of the g5_serdes_cfg_t structure is defined by the enumerated type, g5_serdes_rx_src_t, for the for SERDES receive P/N Output Data Source shown in Table 3 above. The tx_source member of the g5_serdes_cfg_t structure is defined by the enumerated type, g5_serdes_tx_src_t, for the for SERDES transmit P/N Output Data Source shown inTable 2 above.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_pin_status_get()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_pin_status_get() API retrieves the status for the specified SERDES port. The g5_api_serdes_pin_status_get() API has the following input parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The serdes_port_id parameter is the SERDES port number(0-71).
The g5_api_serdes_pin_status_get() API returns the pin_status_ptr pointer with the g5_serdes_pin_status_t structure that has the following members:

The rx_adaption_done status is set to 1 when the receive signal is adapted and receiving valid signal and is cleared to 0 when the receiver is not adapted, or no signal is present. The pll_locked status is set to 1 when the PLL is locked and cleared to 0 when the PLL is unlocked. The signal_detect member indicates the signal detect status, when set to 1 signal is detected, when cleared to 0, no signal is detected. The phy_ready member indicates the PHY ready status. The eyemargin member indicates the NRZ eye margin status. The pam4_eyemargin_0-2 members indicate the pam4 eye margins 0, 1 and 2 in milliVolts.

section.title: g5_api_serdes_pin_cfg_get()
section.p: The g5_api_serdes_pin_cfg_get() API retrieves the configuration for the specified SERDES port. The g5_api_serdes_pin_cfg_get() API has the following input parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The serdes_port_id parameter is the SERDES port number(0-71).
The g5_api_serdes_pin_cfg_get() API returns the pin_cfg_ptr pointer with the g5_serdes_pin_cfg_t structure that has the following members:

The chnl_id member is associated with this SERDES pin. The tx_swing and tx_swing_value_on_next_prov members indicate the current transmit swing value and the value for the next provision of the SERDES pin. The rx_polarity, tx_polarity, rx_polarity_value_on_next_prov and tx_polarity_value_on_next_prov members indicate the current receive and transmit polarity values and the values to be used for the next provision. The pin_mode member indicates the pin mode via the g5_serdes_pin_mode_t enumeration where the enumerator G5_SERDES_PIN_MODE_NRZ configures the SERDES port for rates up to 28 Gbps and the enumerator G5_SERDES_PIN_MODE_PAM4_ADJ configures the SERDES port for 56 Gbps. The tx_prbs_mode and rx_prbs_mode members indicate the PRBS mode via the g5_serdes_prbs_t enumeration shown in P56 SERDES Pattern Generation API. The tx_disable and tx_disable_value_on_next_prov members control the output of the transmitter.

section.title: SDK Example for SERDES Configuration
section.p: This section outlines the example code which apply the specified LOS configuration on SERDES pins which form an OTUC6 interface using quad-SERDES blocks of SHI 0-5 on Bank A.
